content:
By a commentator for the Earn Folket Media.

Earn Folket Media was present at a demonstration outside Equinor's office at Sandsli in Bergen. Protesters blocked the driveway to the office's parking lot. It was a collaboration between the environment, and the climate movement and Palestine activists. The protesters demanded that Equinor stop cooperation with the Israeli company Ithaca Energy and stop the development of the Rosebank oil field.

According to the protesters, similar actions are carried out in Oslo, Florø, Stavanger and London. The demonstration was a collaboration between Palestine's action votes, Stop the oil exploration and extinction Rebellion. The protesters were present early in the morning. With Palestinian flags and posters and banners with the text "Equinor has dirty ties - oil and Israel hand in hand".

The protesters began at 07.30. They held several appeals and shouted slogans. Before 8 o'clock it had built a long queue in the area. And the police were thus forced to show away these cars to prevent the queue from building up. As the clock approached 9, the area was almost empty for cars.

Earn Folket Media has interviewed several of the participants and a spokesperson for the action.

A spokesperson for the action explain why they demonstrate:

“Today, action votes from Palestine, Stop the oil exploration and extinction Rebellion Norway have joined forces to demonstrate against the Rosebank oil platform that will have catastrophic environmental consequences. In addition, this platform will be built with Ithaca Energy. They are owned by Israeli Delek Group. Which is blacklisted by the UN and is a company that contributes to the illegal Israeli settlements. We require the government to follow up its self -esteem report for Equinor. There, they write that companies like Equinor should follow science -based climate goals, cut emissions in line with these, and that they will enter into cooperation with actors who respect international humanitarian law. That's what we stand for here today. That Equinor has a room for maneuver that they should use. They should end the Rose Bank platform and should end the cooperation with Ithaca Energy. ”

Several participants in the action were also interviewed.

An activist explains why such demonstration forms need:

“Because it is very tragic. The politicians do not listen to us. They have no respect for opinion in Norway and the will of the people. And when you resort to more disobedient and desperate methods. Like strike and civil disobedience. Everything is needed to end the genocide and the occupation. "

Another activist explained it like this:

“It's about Equinor's reputation. If people are going to see what Equinor is doing we have to take a seat, we have to scream loudly. It is not enough. We don't think they want to talk to us even if we try it. The environmental movement has tried it many times. Equinor is not an actor you can have a dialogue with I think. ”

The activist explains why dialogue with Equinor is not working:


“Because the entire company is built on the principle of the entire environment can be utilized and also that vulnerable people can be exploited. Yes, they may have a dialogue with us, but Equinor cannot exist if they do not do such things. "


The activist ended with:

“It is very nice to gather the environmental movement and the Palestinian movement here today. It is very important. To explain and show that these problems have something to do with each other. I think solidarity is what determines whether a movement survives or collapses. We need a critical mass. That's the whole point in what we do. I am very proud to see this collaboration. ”

After 9 o'clock, the action ended after there were no longer cars to see in the area. The shareholders succeeded in revealing the collaboration state -owned Equinor has with Israeli Ithaca Energy, which contributes to the occupation. At the same time, a signal was sent that the companies cannot work as normal while contributing to an ongoing genocide.
title: Bergen: activists blocked Equinor for Palestine
